title: MD
biography: Rakesh Kumar Mishra is an Indian scientist specializing in genomics and epigenetics. Mishra retired as the 6th director of CSIR-Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology (CCMB) in Hyderabad, India, on 30 April 2021. He is currently the Director of Tata Institute of Genomics Society (TIGS), Bengaluru and holds J. C. Bose Fellowship at CCMB.
aiSummary: Rakesh Mishra is a molecular biology - genome biology specialist with an H-index of 110 at CCMB (Faculty). Has been published in Molecular and Cellular Biology, Cellular and Molecular Life Sciences, Molecular Cell. Based in India.
